other_tests.findings: Sinus rhythm at a rate of 115 beats per minute, right-axis deviation, left atrial enlargement, Q waves in the inferior leads, low voltage, and nonspecific ST-segment changes.

Mild-to-moderate pericardial effusion, thickening of the left ventricular walls suggestive of concentric left ventricular hypertrophy, normal left ventricular function, dilated pulmonary artery, and mild tricuspid-valve regurgitation. Right ventricular pressure estimated to be 91 mm Hg.
Severe pulmonary hypertension with elevated right atrial pressure, markedly reduced cardiac output, and mixed venous oxygen saturation indicating right ventricular failure.
Reactive lymph node with intact nodal architecture, follicular hyperplasia, paracortical hyperplasia, and plasmacytosis. No evidence of cancer or granulomas.
